intro: Thaspium pinnatifidum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thaspium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, pinnately arranged leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Thaspium pinnatifidum is often found in humid tropical and subtropical regions.
